intro: Cacalia angulosa, commonly known as the angular cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, angular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Cacalia angulosa typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
